title: Blood, Thunder, and the Roar of Italian Doom: “What's Done is Done” Album Review
decscription: If you want blood, if you want uncontained rage, and if on top of that you want to see aggression of sound succeed, then in the period of autumn’s splendor shall you discover it...
content:
If you want blood, if you want uncontained rage, and if on top of that you want to see aggression of sound succeed, then in the period of autumn’s splendor shall you discover it. All you have to remember is that the emotions uncovered are spectacular, and the beat of the Italian embrace of dark doom and ear-splitting destruction is what’s left after the album “What’s Done Is Done” is played.

 

The Lion’s Roar: Aggression Made Pure

For In Autumn, “What’s Done Is Done” is a release of pure aggression. Tracks such as “Despised By Life”, “Lucid Dream”, “Breathing In The Void” and “The Illusion Of Reality” catch the listener by the shoulders, shaking them with insistence and unrelenting passion. The result is one of the most illuminating pieces of Metal.

In Autumn adds their constant growl with a sense of ease that belies the sound’s ferocity. This is the lion’s thunderous roar, the attack of claws outstretched and pointed teeth ready to chew through muscle as the gallant and the brave lose their minds at the ferocity of the animal, the king of the plains in full dynamic mood.

“What's Done is Done” stands as a classic of the genre, growling and fighting with equal tenacity. The album epitomizes the potency of raw emotion and unbridled aggression in music. With tracks that shake the listeners to their core and a sound that resonates with the force of a lion’s roar, this album firmly establishes In Autumn’s position among the metal genre’s elite. So… brace yourself to be engulfed by the album’s intensity and ferocity, as it emerges as an Italian masterpiece!
